title: NRL Grand Final 2019: Raiders vs Roosters live scores, stream
text:
History will be made in front of a capacity crowd.

The Sydney Roosters and Canberra Raiders NRL grand final at ANZ Stadium tonight is officially sold-out.

The last few remaining tickets were snapped-up on Sunday morning which means a crowd in excess of 82,000 will be in attendance for the 7.30pm kick-off.

The Roosters are attempting to become the first team since the 1992-1993 Brisbane Broncos to win back-to-back premierships.

Their rivals Canberra will have an army of green behind them as they strive to snare the club’s first title in 25-years.The general public are being encouraged to provide plenty of time for travel and to use public transport to arrive at ANZ Stadium.

NRL GRAND FINAL DAY

ANZ Stadium, Sydney

12pm Sunday: The area around ANZ Stadium will be transformed into a family friendly zone. The precinct will be free to everyone visiting Sydney Olympic Park.

1.15pm: Gates open

1.35pm: Super State Championship grand final

3.40pm: Women’s Premiership grand final

6.30pm: Retiring and departing players’ class of 2019 on-field tribute, followed by a pre-match show featuring US pop-rockers One Republic.

7.30pm: NRL grand final
